lom:description.lom:string: The ADVANCE project at the University of Rhode Island is a 5-year program funded by the National Science Foundation designed to improve and enrich the scientific, technology, engineering, and mathematic academic workforce at URI through the increased representation and participation of women faculty. URI ADVANCE is involved in recruitment efforts, faculty development, improving networks of support, and overall climate change, to the ultimate benefit of all faculty at the University of Rhode Island.

lom:keyword.lom:string: ADVANCE - NSF, gender equity, women in science, women in mathematics, women in engineering, women in computing

lom:title.lom:string: NSF ADVANCE Program at the University of Rhode Island
